passthrough_vars.description: > Click the plus sign to add a new entry

aggregation_vars.description: > Click the plus sign to add a new entry

snowplow__atomic_schema.title: Schema
snowplow__atomic_schema.description: Schema (dataset) that contains your atomic events
snowplow__atomic_schema.longDescription: The schema (dataset for BigQuery) that contains your atomic events table.

snowplow__database.title: Database
snowplow__database.description: Database that contains your atomic events
snowplow__database.longDescription: The database that contains your atomic events table.

snowplow__dev_target_name.title: Dev Target
snowplow__dev_target_name.description: Target name of your development environment as defined in your `profiles.yml` file
snowplow__dev_target_name.longDescription: The [target name](https://docs.getdbt.com/docs/core/connect-data-platform/profiles.yml) of your development environment as defined in your `profiles.yml` file. See the [Manifest Tables](/docs/modeling-your-data/modeling-your-data-with-dbt/package-mechanics/manifest-tables/) section for more details.

snowplow__events_table.title: Events Table
snowplow__events_table.description: The name of the table that contains your atomic events
snowplow__events_table.longDescription: The name of the table that contains your atomic events.

snowplow__heartbeat.title: Heartbeat
snowplow__heartbeat.description: Page ping heartbeat time as defined in your tracker configuration
snowplow__heartbeat.longDescription: Page ping heartbeat time as defined in your [tracker configuration](/docs/collecting-data/collecting-from-own-applications/javascript-trackers/web-tracker/tracking-events/#activity-tracking-page-pings).

snowplow__min_visit_length.title: Min Visit length
snowplow__min_visit_length.description: Minimum visit length as defined in your tracker configuration
snowplow__min_visit_length.longDescription: Minimum visit length as defined in your [tracker configuration](/docs/collecting-data/collecting-from-own-applications/javascript-trackers/web-tracker/tracking-events/#activity-tracking-page-pings).

snowplow__sessions_table.title: Sessions Table
snowplow__sessions_table.description: The users module requires data from the derived sessions table. If you choose to disable the standard sessions table in favor of your own custom table, set this to reference your new table e.g. {{ ref("snowplow_unified_sessions_custom") }}
snowplow__sessions_table.longDescription: The users module requires data from the derived sessions table. If you choose to disable the standard sessions table in favor of your own custom table, set this to reference your new table e.g. `{{ ref(\'snowplow_unified_sessions_custom\') }}`. Please see the [README](https://github.com/snowplow/dbt-snowplow-unified/tree/main/custom_example) in the `custom_example` directory for more information on this sort of implementation.

snowplow__allow_refresh.title: Allow Refresh
snowplow__allow_refresh.longDescription: Used as the default value to return from the `allow_refresh()` macro. This macro determines whether the manifest tables can be refreshed or not, depending on your environment. See the [Manifest Tables](/docs/modeling-your-data/modeling-your-data-with-dbt/package-mechanics/manifest-tables/) section for more details.

snowplow__backfill_limit_days.title: Backfill Limit
snowplow__backfill_limit_days.longDescription: The maximum numbers of days of new data to be processed since the latest event processed. Please refer to the [incremental logic](/docs/modeling-your-data/modeling-your-data-with-dbt/package-mechanics/incremental-processing/#package-state) section for more details.
snowplow__backfill_limit_days.description: The maximum numbers of days of new data to be processed since the latest event processed

snowplow__conversion_events.title: Conversion Definition
snowplow__conversion_events.description: > Click the plus sign to add a new entry
snowplow__conversion_events.longDescription: A list of dictionaries that define a conversion event for your modeling, to add the relevant columns to the sessions table. The dictionary keys are `name` (required), `condition` (required), `value`, `default_value`, and `list_events`. For more information see the [package documentation](/docs/modeling-your-data/modeling-your-data-with-dbt/dbt-models/dbt-unified-data-model/conversions/).

snowplow__cwv_days_to_measure.title: CWV Days To Measure
snowplow__cwv_days_to_measure.longDescription: The number of days to use for web vital measurements (if enabled).
snowplow__cwv_days_to_measure.description: The number of days to use for web vital measurements (if enabled)

snowplow__cwv_percentile.title: CWV Percentile
snowplow__cwv_percentile.longDescription: The percentile that the web vitals measurements that are produced for all page views (if enabled).
snowplow__cwv_percentile.description: The percentile that the web vitals measurements that are produced for all page views (if enabled)

snowplow__days_late_allowed.title: Days Late Allowed
snowplow__days_late_allowed.longDescription: The maximum allowed number of days between the event creation and it being sent to the collector. Exists to reduce lengthy table scans that can occur as a result of late arriving data.
snowplow__days_late_allowed.description: The maximum allowed number of days between the event creation and it being sent to the collector

snowplow__lookback_window_hours.title: Event Lookback Window
snowplow__lookback_window_hours.longDescription: The number of hours to look before the latest event processed - to account for late arriving data, which comes out of order.
snowplow__lookback_window_hours.description: The number of hours to look before the latest event processed - to account for late arriving data, which comes out of order

snowplow__max_session_days.title: Max Session Length
snowplow__max_session_days.longDescription: The maximum allowed session length in days. For a session exceeding this length, all events after this limit will stop being processed. Exists to reduce lengthy table scans that can occur due to long sessions which are usually a result of bots.
snowplow__max_session_days.description: The maximum allowed session length in days. For a session exceeding this length, all events after this limit will stop being processed

snowplow__session_lookback_days.title: Session Lookback Window
snowplow__session_lookback_days.longDescription: Number of days to limit scan on `snowplow_unified_base_sessions_lifecycle_manifest` manifest. Exists to improve performance of model when we have a lot of sessions. Should be set to as large a number as practical.
snowplow__session_lookback_days.description: Number of days to limit scan on `snowplow_unified_base_sessions_lifecycle_manifest` manifest

snowplow__session_stitching.title: Enable Session Stitching
snowplow__session_stitching.longDescription: Determines whether to apply the user mapping to the sessions table. Please see the [User Mapping](/docs/modeling-your-data/modeling-your-data-with-dbt/package-features/identity-stitching/) section for more details.

snowplow__start_date.title: Start Date
snowplow__start_date.longDescription: The date to start processing events from in the package on first run or a full refresh, based on `collector_tstamp`
snowplow__start_date.description: The date to start processing events from in the package on first run or a full refresh, based on `collector_tstamp`

snowplow__total_all_conversions.title: Total All Conversions
snowplow__total_all_conversions.longDescription: A boolean flag whether to calculate and add the `cv__all_volume` and `cv__all_total` columns. For more information see the [package documentation](/docs/modeling-your-data/modeling-your-data-with-dbt/dbt-models/dbt-unified-data-model/conversions/).

snowplow__upsert_lookback_days.title: Upsert Lookback Days
snowplow__upsert_lookback_days.longDescription: Number of days to look back over the incremental derived tables during the upsert. Where performance is not a concern, should be set to as long a value as possible. Having too short a period can result in duplicates. Please see the [Snowplow Optimized Materialization](/docs/modeling-your-data/modeling-your-data-with-dbt/package-mechanics/optimized-upserts/) section for more details.
snowplow__upsert_lookback_days.description: Number of days to look back over the incremental derived tables during the upsert

snowplow__app_id.description: > Click the plus sign to add a new entry
snowplow__app_id.title: App IDs
snowplow__app_id.longDescription: A list of `app_id`s to filter the events table on for processing within the package.

snowplow__enable_cwv.longDescription: Flag to enable the [Core Web Vitals](/docs/modeling-your-data/modeling-your-data-with-dbt/dbt-models/dbt-unified-data-model/core-web-vitals-module/) module.
snowplow__enable_cwv.title: Enable Core Web Vitals Module

snowplow__enable_iab.longDescription: Flag to include the [IAB enrichment](/docs/enriching-your-data/available-enrichments/iab-enrichment/) data in the models.
snowplow__enable_iab.title: Enable IAB

snowplow__enable_ua.longDescription: Flag to include the [UA Parser enrichment](/docs/enriching-your-data/available-enrichments/ua-parser-enrichment/) data in the models.
snowplow__enable_ua.title: Enable UA

snowplow__enable_yauaa.longDescription: Flag to include the [YAUAA enrichment](/docs/enriching-your-data/available-enrichments/yauaa-enrichment/) data in the models.
snowplow__enable_yauaa.title: Enable YAUAA

snowplow__enable_browser_context.longDescription: Flag to include fields extracted from the [Browser context](/docs/collecting-data/collecting-from-own-applications/snowplow-tracker-protocol/ootb-data/device-and-browser/index.md#browser-context) data in the models (JS tracker <3.17), can be used together with `snowplow__enable_browser_context_2` (supports 2nd major schema version) to coalesce the two.
snowplow__enable_browser_context.title: Enable Browser Context

snowplow__enable_browser_context_2.longDescription: Flag to include fields extracted from the 2nd major version of schemas related to the [Browser context](/docs/collecting-data/collecting-from-own-applications/snowplow-tracker-protocol/ootb-data/device-and-browser/index.md#browser-context) data in the models (JS tracker (>=3.17), can be used together with `snowplow__enable_browser_context` for previous versions to coalesce the two.
snowplow__enable_browser_context_2.title: Enable Browser Context 2

snowplow__has_log_enabled.longDescription: When executed, the package logs information about the current run to the CLI. This can be disabled by setting to `false`.
snowplow__has_log_enabled.title: Enable Run Logs

snowplow__ua_bot_filter.longDescription: Flag to filter out bots via the `useragent` string pattern match.
snowplow__ua_bot_filter.title: Filter Bots

snowplow__databricks_catalog.title: (Databricks) Catalog
snowplow__databricks_catalog.longDescription: The catalogue your atomic events table is in. Depending on the use case it should either be the catalog (for Unity Catalog users from databricks connector 1.1.1 onwards, defaulted to `hive_metastore`) or the same value as your `snowplow__atomic_schema` (unless changed it should be 'atomic').
snowplow__databricks_catalog.description: The catalogue your atomic events table is in

snowplow__enable_load_tstamp.title: (Redshift) Enable load_tstamp
snowplow__enable_load_tstamp.longDescription: Flag to include the `load_tstamp` column in the base events this run model. This should be set to true (the default) unless you are using the Postgres loader or an RDB loader version less than 4.0.0. It must be true to use consent models on Postgres and Redshift.

snowplow__derived_tstamp_partitioned.title: (Bigquery) Derived Timestamp Partition
snowplow__derived_tstamp_partitioned.longDescription: Boolean to enable filtering the events table on `derived_tstamp` in addition to `collector_tstamp`.

snowplow__ga4_categories_seed.title: Seed reference for GA4 Categories
snowplow__ga4_categories_seed.longDescription: Name of the model for the GA4 category mapping seed table, either a seed or a model (if you want to use a source, create a model to select from it).

snowplow__geo_mapping_seed.title: Seed reference for geo mapping
snowplow__geo_mapping_seed.longDescription: Name of the model for the Geo mapping seed table, either a seed or a model (if you want to use a source, create a model to select from it).

snowplow__rfc_5646_seed.title: Seed reference for rfc 5646 (language mapping)
snowplow__rfc_5646_seed.longDescription: Name of the model for the RFC 5646 (language) mapping seed table, either a seed or a model (if you want to use a source, create a model to select from it).

snowplow__session_identifiers.title: Session Identifiers
snowplow__session_identifiers.longDescription: A list of key:value dictionaries which contain all of the contexts and fields where your session identifiers are located. For each entry in the list, if your map contains the `schema` value `atomic`, then this refers to a field found directly in the atomic `events` table. If you are trying to introduce a context/entity with an identifier in it, the package will look for the context in your events table with the name specified in the `schema` field. It will use the specified value in the `field` key as the field name to access. For Redshift/Postgres, using the `schema` key the package will try to find a table in your `snowplow__events_schema` schema with the same name as the `schema` value provided, and join that. If multiple fields are specified, the package will try to coalesce all fields in the order specified in the list. For a better understanding of the advanced usage of this variable, please see the [Custom Identifiers](/docs/modeling-your-data/modeling-your-data-with-dbt/package-features/custom-identifiers/) section for more details.
snowplow__session_identifiers.description: > Click the plus sign to add a new entry

schema.title: (JSON) schema name for the field
schema.description: The schema name of your events table, atomic in most use cases, alternatively for sdes/contexts this should instead be the name of the field itself

field.title: Field name
field.description: The name of the field to use as session identifier, alternatively, in case of sdes/contexts it is the name of the element that refers to the field to be extracted

snowplow__session_sql.title: SQL for your session identifier
snowplow__session_sql.longDescription: This allows you to override the `session_identifiers` SQL, to define completely custom SQL in order to build out a session identifier for your events. If you are interested in using this instead of providing identifiers through the `session_identifiers` variable, please see the [Custom Identifiers](/docs/modeling-your-data/modeling-your-data-with-dbt/package-features/custom-identifiers/) section for more details on how to do that.

snowplow__session_timestamp.title: Timestamp used for incremental processing, should be your partition field
snowplow__session_timestamp.longDescription: Determines which timestamp is used to build the sessionization logic. It's a good idea to have this timestamp be the same timestamp as the field you partition your events table on.

snowplow__user_identifiers.title: User Identifiers
snowplow__user_identifiers.longDescription: A list of key:value dictionaries which contain all of the contexts and fields where your user identifiers are located. For each entry in the list, if your map contains the `schema` value `atomic`, then this refers to a field found directly in the atomic `events` table. If you are trying to introduce a context/entity with an identifier in it, the package will look for the context in your events table with the name specified in the `schema` field. It will use the specified value in the `field` key as the field name to access. For Redshift/Postgres, using the `schema` key the package will try to find a table in your `snowplow__events_schema` schema with the same name as the `schema` value provided, and join that. If multiple fields are specified, the package will try to coalesce all fields in the order specified in the list. For a better understanding of the advanced usage of this variable, please see the [Custom Identifiers](/docs/modeling-your-data/modeling-your-data-with-dbt/package-features/custom-identifiers/) section for more details.
snowplow__user_identifiers.description: > Click the plus sign to add a new entry

schema.title: (JSON) schema name for the field
schema.description: The schema name of your events table, atomic in most use cases, alternatively for sdes/contexts this should instead be the name of the field itself

field.title: Field name
field.description: The name of the field to use as user identifier, alternatively, in case of sdes/contexts it is the name of the element that refers to the field to be extracted

snowplow__user_sql.title: SQL for your user identifier
snowplow__user_sql.longDescription: This allows you to override the `user_identifiers` SQL, to define completely custom SQL in order to build out a user identifier for your events. If you are interested in using this instead of providing identifiers through the `user_identifiers` variable, please see the [Custom Identifiers](/docs/modeling-your-data/modeling-your-data-with-dbt/package-features/custom-identifiers/) section for more details on how to do that.

snowplow__user_stitching_id.title: Field used when stitching together users
snowplow__user_stitching_id.longDescription: This is the user_id you want to stitch to sessions (and/or page views) with matching domain_userids. It supports raw `sql` expressions.

snowplow__view_passthroughs.title: Page View Passthroughs
snowplow__view_passthroughs.longDescription: Field(s) to carry through from the events table to the derived table. The field is from the `page/screen_view` event record. Aggregation is not supported. A list of either flat column names from the events table or a dictionary with the keys `sql` for the SQL code to select the column and `alias` for the alias of the column in the output. See the [Passthrough field](/docs/modeling-your-data/modeling-your-data-with-dbt/package-features/passthrough-fields/) docs for more information.

snowplow__session_passthroughs.title: Session Passthroughs
snowplow__session_passthroughs.longDescription: Field(s) to carry through from the events table to the derived table. The field is based on the first `page/screen_view` or `page_ping` event for that session. Aggregation is not supported. A list of either flat column names from the events table or a dictionary with the keys `sql` for the SQL code to select the column and `alias` for the alias of the column in the output.

snowplow__user_first_passthroughs.title: User First Passthroughs
snowplow__user_first_passthroughs.longDescription: Field(s) to carry through from the events table to the derived table. The field is based on the first session record for that user. Aggregation is not supported. A list of either flat column names from the sessions table or a dictionary with the keys `sql` for the SQL code to select the column and `alias` for the alias of the column in the output.

snowplow__user_last_passthroughs.title: User Last Passthroughs
snowplow__user_last_passthroughs.longDescription: Field(s) to carry through from the events table to the derived table. The field is based on the last session record for that user. Aggregation is not supported. A list of either flat column names from the sessions table or a dictionary with the keys `sql` for the SQL code to select the column and `alias` for the alias of the column in the output. See the [Passthrough field](/docs/modeling-your-data/modeling-your-data-with-dbt/package-features/passthrough-fields/) docs for more information. Note flat fields will be aliased with a `last_` prefix, dictionary provided aliases will not by default.

snowplow__conversion_passthroughs.title: User Conversion Passthroughs
snowplow__conversion_passthroughs.longDescription: Field(s) to carry through from the events table to the derived table. The field is based on the events_this_run table therefore taking all events. Aggregation is not supported. A list of either flat column names from the events table or a dictionary with the keys `sql` for the SQL code to select the column and `alias` for the alias of the column in the output.  See the [Passthrough field](/docs/modeling-your-data/modeling-your-data-with-dbt/package-features/passthrough-fields/) docs for more information.Note flat fields will be aliased with a `last_` prefix, dictionary provided aliases will not by default.

snowplow__entities_or_sdes.title: (Redshift) Entities or SDEs
snowplow__entities_or_sdes.longDescription: A list of dictionaries defining the `entity` or `self-describing` event tables to join onto your base events table. Please use the tool below or see the section on [Utilizing custom contexts or SDEs](/docs/modeling-your-data/modeling-your-data-with-dbt/package-features/modeling-entities/) for details of the structure.
snowplow__entities_or_sdes.description: > Click the plus sign to add a new entry

snowplow__view_stitching.title: Enable View Stitching
snowplow__view_stitching.longDescription: Determines whether to apply the user mapping to the views table. Note this can be an expensive operation to do every run. One way to mitigate this is by running this update with less frequency than your usual run by enabling this variable only for that specific run. Please see the [User Mapping](/docs/modeling-your-data/modeling-your-data-with-dbt/package-features/identity-stitching/) section for more details.

snowplow__conversion_stitching.title: Enable Conversion Stitching
snowplow__conversion_stitching.longDescription: Determines whether to apply the user mapping to the conversions table. Please see the [User Mapping](/docs/modeling-your-data/modeling-your-data-with-dbt/package-features/identity-stitching/) section for more details.

snowplow__list_event_counts.title: List Per-Event Counts
snowplow__list_event_counts.longDescription: A boolean whether to include a json-type (varies by warehouse) column in the sessions table with a count of events for each `event_type` in that session.

snowplow__enable_mobile_context.title: Enable Mobile Context
snowplow__enable_mobile_context.longDescription: Flag to include mobile context data in the models

snowplow__enable_geolocation_context.title: Enable Geolocation Context
snowplow__enable_geolocation_context.longDescription: Flag to include the geolocation data in the models.

snowplow__enable_application_context.title: Enable App Context
snowplow__enable_application_context.longDescription: Flag to include the app context data in the models.

snowplow__enable_screen_context.title: Enable Screen Context
snowplow__enable_screen_context.longDescription: Flag to include the mobile screen data in the models.

snowplow__enable_app_errors.title: Enable App Error Context
snowplow__enable_app_errors.longDescription: Flag to include the mobile app error data in the models.

snowplow__enable_conversions.title: Enable Conversions
snowplow__enable_conversions.longDescription: Flag to enable the conversions optional module.

snowplow__enable_deep_link_context.title: Enable Deep Link Context
snowplow__enable_deep_link_context.longDescription: Flag to include the deep link context data in the models.

snowplow__enable_mobile.title: Enable Mobile Data
snowplow__enable_mobile.longDescription: Flag to process mobile events throughout the package.

snowplow__enable_web.title: Enable Web Data
snowplow__enable_web.longDescription: Flag to process web events throughout the package.

snowplow__enable_screen_summary_context.title: Enable Screen Summary Context
snowplow__enable_screen_summary_context.longDescription: Flag to process the screen engagement information in the screen summary context on mobile events.

snowplow__custom_sql.title: Custom SQL
snowplow__custom_sql.longDescription: This allows you to introduce custom sql to the `snowplow_unified_events_this_run` table, which you can then leverage in downstream models. For more information on the usage, see the following page on the [advanced usage of the utils package](/docs/modeling-your-data/modeling-your-data-with-dbt/dbt-custom-models/examples/additional-sql-on-events-this-run/).
snowplow__custom_sql.description: Custom SQL for your events this run table.

snowplow__view_aggregations.title: View Aggregations
snowplow__view_aggregations.longDescription: Aggregations to calculate as part of the the derived table. A list of dictionaries defining the type (sum, avg, min, max, count, countd), field to aggregate, and what to alias the column.

snowplow__session_aggregations.title: Session Aggregations
snowplow__session_aggregations.longDescription: Aggregations to calculate as part of the the derived table. A list of dictionaries defining the type (sum, avg, min, max, count, countd), field to aggregate, and what to alias the column.

snowplow__user_aggregations.title: User First Aggregations
snowplow__user_aggregations.longDescription: Aggregations to calculate as part of the the derived table. A list of dictionaries defining the type (sum, avg, min, max, count, countd), field to aggregate, and what to alias the column.

snowplow__grant_select_to.description: > Click the plus sign to add a new entry
snowplow__grant_select_to.title: Grant Select List
snowplow__grant_select_to.longDescription: A list of users to grant select to all tables created by this package to.

snowplow__grant_schema_usage.title: Enable grant usage
snowplow__grant_schema_usage.longDescription: Enables granting usage on schemas interacted with on a dbt run

snowplow__use_refr_if_mkt_null.description: Use refr fields when mkt fields are null for default channel group
snowplow__use_refr_if_mkt_null.title: Use Refr if Mkt is null
snowplow__use_refr_if_mkt_null.longDescription: Use the refr fields when the mkt fields are null for the definition of default channel group. This is a common case when for example a landing page has a redirect.

snowplow__enable_initial_checks.description: Use this field to enable initial checks when changing the package configuration to ensure quick fails if the configuration is incorrect
snowplow__enable_initial_checks.title: Enable Initial Checks
snowplow__enable_initial_checks.longDescription: Use this field to test the existance of all the seed models in the dwh and the existence of contexts that are needed based on your configuration. This is useful when changing the package configuration to ensure quick fails if the configuration is incorrect.

snowplow__snowflake_lakeloader.description: Enable running the models on an iceberg table using lakeloader data
snowplow__snowflake_lakeloader.title: (Snowflake) Using lakeloader?
snowplow__snowflake_lakeloader.longDescription: To use the models on an iceberg events table created via the lakeloader on Snowflake, this will need to be enabled due to different table structures.

snowplow__allow_null_dvce_tstamps.description: Use this field to bypass optimization which avoids long scans due to late arriving data for trackers which do not send dvce_created or sent tstamps.
snowplow__allow_null_dvce_tstamps.title: Allow Null Device Timestamps
snowplow__allow_null_dvce_tstamps.longDescription: Use this field to bypass optimization which avoids long scans due to late arriving data. Warning, use this field only when using specific older versions of the AMP tracker or the Pixel tracker.
